summary: +Experienced SIGINT Geospatial-Metadata Analyst/Intelligence Analyst/Linguist +Skilled in the use of several Intelligence tools and resources: ANCHORY, AMHS, NUCLEON, TRAFFICTHIEF, ARCMAP, SIGNAV, COASTLINE, DISHFIRE, FASTSCOPE, OCTAVE/CONTRAOCTAVE, PINWALE, UTT, WEBCANDID, MICHIGAN, PLUS, ASSOCIATION, MAINWAY, FASCIA, OCTSKYWARD, INTELINK, METRICS, BANYAN, MARINA + Deployed to use SIGINT to provide Force Protection to American and allied personnel +Acted as primary liaison for NSA during daily teleconferences with other government partners, exchanging ideas and information to maintain complete and up-to-date situational awareness +Translated foreign language materials from Somali and French into English and made targeted briefings to strategic leadership regarding regional security matters +Used a variety of tools and data to provide advanced threat warnings to American civilian, government, and military personnel +Compiled supplemental threat summaries for specific topical meetings of senior leadership, providing them with a fuller global terrorism situational awareness +Prepared topic-specific, detailed presentations for senior leadership using Powerpoint, Word, ZapGrab, ARCMap, and SIGNAV +Routinely wrote articles for CT today, considered a “must-read” by Agency senior leadership and NSA representatives at other organizations. +Collaborated with partners worldwide to enable efficient, real-time support in a 24/7 shift environment +Have worked in both foreign and domestic environments and managed to facilitate smooth exchanges between foreign partners that allowed for maximum efficiency of both parties +Repeatedly called upon to train new employees in a variety of positions +Improved the quality and immediate usefulness of office reporting, directly resulting in an increase of 15% in requests for this product. +Able to filter vast amounts of data and reports to identify key information critical to ongoing projects

description: • Assisted in Migrating 188+ databases from .MIL to .EDU and operating systems from /Microsoft SQL Server 2005/Windows 2003/32-bit/ upgraded to /Microsoft SQL Server 2008 R2/Windows server 2008 R2/ 64-bit on Enterprise Edition. • Performed Database & Server Maintenance on Microsoft SQL Server 2005/2008 R2 databases and clusters residing on Windows server 2003/2008 R2. • Monitored mission critical IT infrastructure components, including system metrics, Network Protocols, Applications, Services, Servers, and Network infrastructure via Nagios. • Assisted in Configuration of CPU, RAM, BIOS settings, and disk partitions in addition to ongoing performance tuning, hardware upgrades, and resource optimization as required. • Familiar with Network TCP/IP Addressing & Subnets, Ports & Protocols, Wireless Encryption, Topologies, Network Types, Devices, Tools as well as Cabling and connectors. • Experience with VMWare ESXi host/client, virtual, exchange, LANDesk, system patch management, windows client and server exposure • Managed file systems, storage devices, networked servers and workstations. •Basic Knowledge of security threats from Firewall (FW), Intrusion Detection Systems (IDS), Intrusion Prevention Systems (IPS), Antivirus (AV), Network Access Control (NAC) and other security threat data sources •Basic experience working with log and monitoring management systems, security event monitoring systems, network-based and host-based intrusion detection systems, firewall technologies, malware detection and enterprise-level antivirus solutions/systems •Minimum exposure to SANS top 20 critical security controls •Experience with ticketing systems such as Remedy, JIRA •Experience with TCP/IP networking skills to perform network troubleshooting to isolate and diagnose common network problems

description: •Experience working in a 24x7x365 Security Operations Center (SOC)& Sensitive Compartmented Information Facilities (SCIF) • Worked with Field Software Engineer(s) and DBA Administrators in the field to Maintain/ Monitor/ and Administer DCGS-A Intelligence Systems to include Network and Systems Security, Disaster Recovery, Hardware / Software, Troubleshooting Networks, Operating Systems, Database and image backups, Restore data after field events, Systems are in compliance with the network requirements. •Exercised (Basic Security) in following areas Physical, Digital, Preventive, Workstation, Wireless/Wired Network, Mobile •Exercised (Basic Trouble shooting) in following areas Malware Removal, Laptop, Common security Issues, Operating systems, Hardware, Hard Drive • Knowledgeable in Security Prevention Methods, Security Awareness, Common Security Threats, Securing windows workstation and SOHO Networks, as well as Disposing of Sensitive Data. • Performed updates, patches, data cleaning, data fidelity controls, purging procedures, and backed-up TED databases, project files and multimedia files on 7 DCGS-A Interoperability (IOP) servers at 7 different FOB's covering all of IRAQ. • Preformed Daily pre-set Structured Query Language (SQL) scripts to access DB Tools, TQT, Query tool databases using Oracle database on DCGS-A workstation • Responsible for adding and removing users, adding and removing hardware, performing backups, installing new software, monitoring systems, performance management, troubleshooting by diagnosing and correcting problems • Mentored/ trained/ over-the-shoulder intelligence analysts, leaders, on Distributed Common Ground System-Army (DCGS-A) Multifunction Workstation, Intelligence SIGINT systems, and Tactical Entity Databases (TED) and applications. •Experience working with import-export tools and wizards for data transfers and dissemination between different DBMS. •Current on latest security threats, common exploits, and vulnerabilities

description: •Experience working in a 24x7x365 Sensitive Compartmented Information Facilities (SCIF) •Assisted US Army Security Team in training, advising, and supervising the New Iraqi Security forces. •Trains and advises intelligence analysts in the Directorate General of Intelligence and Security (DGIS), in strategic intelligence analysis, production and dissemination •Trains DGIS intelligence analysts on providing support to Iraqi National Operations Center (NOC) and Joint Headquarters (JHQ) mission requirements. Assures intelligence producers plans and operations align with current and future strategic intelligence objectives •Employs the following methods to interact with Iraqi officials: continuous personal contact to establish mutual trust, confidence and confidentiality; presentation of substantive material on general and specific subjects related to the mission; assistance on the development, implementation and oversight of policies and procedures that enable them to fulfill their intelligence mission (Communication Security, Information Security, and Physical Security) •Supports Deputy Commanding General Advisory and Training Mission Iraq and Develops Iraqi security forces and ministries, by delivering SIGINT training and equipment fielding for the Iraqi Ministry of Defense •Coordinates with Intelligence Military Security School (IMSS) staff in developing Intelligence training for the Iraqi National intelligence Community •Mobile Team Trainer (MTT) for 13 Iraqi Army Intelligence Surveillance and Reconnaissance (ISR) Divisions in signals of interest collection Tactics, Techniques, and Procedures (TTP) •Supported MULTI-NATIONAL SECURITY TRANSITION COMMAND IRAQ (MNSTC-I) Baghdad, Iraq

description: • Conducted time sensitive reporting in a concise accurate manner for the Afghanistan Remote Operations Cryptologic Center (AROCC) in support of International Security Assistance Force (ISAF) operations and Collection Management Authority (CMA) requirements. • Performed evaluation, sanitization, and quality assurance measures of reports based on AROCC reporting branch SOP and NSA policies. • Personally have written or conducted quality control of a combined 23,000 + Klieglight formatted reports. • Responsible for recognizing and reporting advance threat warnings to protect Coalition Forces. • Maintained existing IJC reporting criteria guidelines and created new reporting standards to ensure tailored SIGINT products and relevant information was disseminated to the customer. • Coordinated with both on and off site SIGINT teams to ensure that our products populated the appropriate databases for widest possible dissemination. • Performed duties directly in support of foreign release (FORREL) requests for information (RFI). • Supervised the execution of routine reporting branch operations and accounted for shift personnel. • Responsible for the training, both initial and advanced, of multiple employees to a common standard while still conducting my regular duties. • Identifying, diagnosing, and troubleshooting communications and system issues; report unresolved issues to support personnel. • Maintained local archives of all final products, ensuring their orderly storage and adherence to naming conventions.

description: Responsible for several market areas of the Ford and Lincoln automotive dealership retail image program. Provided architectural design and construction administration for over 200 dealership renovations and new construction projects. - Site visits to dealerships to consult with dealership ownership team, to discuss the Ford program requirements, and discuss design solutions. - Prepared programming and conceptual design. Provided architectural design package including site plans, floor plans, furniture layouts, elevations, renderings, and typical construction details. - Fast tracked the design and construction administration for over 20 Lincoln dealerships to meet the new Lincoln retail image program requirements. - Provide design solutions to integrate Quick Lane Tire and Auto Center retail business into existing dealership service departments. - Create construction cost estimates. description: Providing support and updated requirements for developers to successfully solution software for a new healthcare product. While learning within a new environment and creating requirements for customized software, brought to the team new ideas to accomplish goals and ensure the project continues to move forward. • Worked with external teams to develop customer facing documentation, not previously implemented by this team. Developed new workflows to support the project in the future. • Created a workflow document using Visio, in order to compare the technical constraints against the functional business requirements. description: Developing a Pickup and Delivery system for UTi Worldwide global parcel tracking system. Deliver successfully completed Sprints for a new Software development project, while increasing point velocity due to detailed and excellent Acceptance Criteria, allowing the development team to code with confidence and Quality Assurance to write test scripts against the Acceptance Criteria. Effectively executes multiple tasks and assignments ahead of expected schedule. Cultivates a reputation for dedication to teamwork, high energy, work ethics, and commitment, with capacity to handle new technologies and situations. • Managing first Agile Scrum team with completed QA testing within the sprint, on code written in the same sprint, allowing for testing, fixing any defects, and retesting. No defects carried forward to new sprints. • Triaging level 1, critical defects, for a worldwide deployment of a mission critical system. • When originally forming the team, assumed responsibility as the Product Owner, Scrum Master, and Senior Business Analyst simultaneously, until the necessary member roles were added and trained. • After 6 weeks of joining the team, successfully presented to worldwide stakeholders the project roadmap for 3 releases, or 12 sprints, including prioritization of the work, our deliverables, schedule and risk assessments. • Leading team in daily Scrum meetings, Pre-sprint Planning, Sprint Commitments and Review Demo. • With the first sprint, team achieved 100% completion of committed stories, additional stretch goals, and zero defects, presenting a well-received first demo of the new product, Pickup and Delivery. • Help to prepare Logical Data Models that contain sets of diagrams and supporting documents containing the essential business elements and descriptions of the relationships between the data elements to document business workflow requirements.

description: Provided systems analysis and support for new Google software development. Retroactively providing the necessary documentation of the new systems and providing expert level trouble-shooting to support the county-wide implementation efforts. Resolved software issues and improved workflow and functionality for the county, while completing the transition to the newest version for Google Government. Business: Created documentation for current processes; developed new processes for efficiency; identified potential system integration; provided testing and training for the new system and upgrade. Technical: Standards development; enhanced end-user experience; systems analysis; documentation customization; developed new processes. • Created system specific documentation for a Google Enterprise environment (browser-based applications), replacing the Microsoft product line. Emphasis on the easy access and collaborative tools of the Cloud. • Provided analysis of the system design, which had been left undocumented during the implementation, and determined where system failures occurred. Advised and followed-up on updating the system functionality. • Produced unique training documentation for end-users and IT departments. • Supported and assisted with Tier 3 support issues for Google-related problems. • Original contract was for 6-7 months, but completed the system design documentation and facilitated the Google Apps upgrade in less than 4 months.

description: Extensive experience in Business process design, streamlining, application systems analysis, system analysis and design, Quality Assurance and software verification and validation process. Skilled in gathering user requirements, performing gap analysis and translating them into structured data, functional and usability requirements. Expert in writing feasibility, estimate, business, functional, training and test requirement documentation. Incorporated project management skills for smaller projects. Business Requirements: Gathered user requirements, performed gap analysis and translated them into structured data and business processes. Provided Project Charters and estimates to develop timelines. Functional Requirements: Designed and developed User Interfaces for proprietary software, including Brokerage and Ocean transportation workflows. Wrote Functional documents to include Business Requirements, Business Rules, Functional Requirements, and non-Functional Requirements. Testing Requirements: Experience in creating Use Case scenarios and end-to-end lifecycle testing. • Worked extensively on a $7 million project to redesigned ocean transportation software, in designed a new User Interface for the international business community. The original estimate was 9 months to gather all the requirements and my team and I completed the task in 90 days and on target. • Designed and developed the new User Interface for Brokerage imports and integrated 5 other downstream systems. Utilized my experience and knowledge to test and troubleshoot the end product. • Create documentation and training material for fellow analysts, supporting the field when new modifications to existing software are required and implemented.

summary: Currently hold a Top Secret Clearance w/ CI Scope Poly Signals Intelligence Analyst with over 10 years experience in the Intelligence Community; experience includes collecting, compiling, analyzing and reporting multi-source intelligence information in support of national and theater-level requirements; experienced with Network Analysis, Open and All Source Analysis and Target Development. Analytic Thinking - 10+ year background working as a Signals Intelligence Analyst in US Army and with in the Intelligence community in a variety locations, working a wide range of missions, targets, and projects. Research - Strong background in researching information critical to management and leadership and presenting that information to Leadership in an accurate and timely manner. Information Management - Maintained many critical databases providing timely support to local and national leaders during 24 hour operations and national crisis. Problem Detection and Solution - Immersive background at developing new missions and targets, identifying problems and solution, particularly in difficult circumstances requiring thinking outside the box. Writing- Trained to write reports for various agencies in the Department of Defense and communicate quickly and concisely critical information to decision makers through emails, reports, briefings, presentations, and other documents. Oral Communication - Provided detailed briefings to upper level management and local, strategic and national level decision makers Liason Worked with nearly every agency in the Intelligence Community, have a clear understanding of their mission responsibility and capabilities. summary: I am professional and accomplished Intelligence Analyst with 18 years experience supporting military and national defense. I possess a TS/SCI/CI/Poly Clearance and I am now seeking career opportunities with defense, intelligence and security contractors to continue my career in intelligence community as a Signal Intelligence (SIGINT) Analyst. I am self-motivated individual and very proficient in multiple disciplines of Signals Analysis; SIGINT Geospatial Anlysis (SGA), Analysis and Reporting, Cyberspace Warfare, and proficient in multiple all source intelligence databases and tools including: PINWALE, HOMEBASE, ArcGIS, ARCVIEW, SEDB, FASCIA, DISHFIRE, MAINWAY, CPE, RENOIR, OCTAVE, ANCHORY/MAUI, CREST, AMHS, INTELINK, SPOTBEAM, BEAMER, SKYWRITER, CONTRACTIVE, GOOGLE EARTH, DRT, GCCS-M, TAC, SIGNAV and RFMP-Builder. I am a problem solver, critical thinker, motivated and dedicated team player who has proven results and communicates authoritatively, both orally and written. As a work-center Subject Matter Expert, I focused on activities in Middle Eastern and Africa regions for nine years and fuse intelligence from SIGINT and GEOINT collected resources to developed reliable intelligence reports or recommendation packages to support national mission assignments, effects planning, and non-kinetic fire mission. As a Senior Analyst, I helped managed all aspects of the mission requirements and built a client base by consistently providing excellent service. I am a great technical mentor and trainer and have authored five technical standard operation procedure (SOP) booklets to improve collection and training pipelines. I am willing to relocate to Maryland, Washington D.C., Northern Virginia, Augusta Georgia, San Diego CA, and overseas.

education: [{"name"=>"University of Maryland College Park", "description"=>"", "period"=>"2001 – 2007"}]
summary: I am professional and accomplished Intelligence Analyst with 18 years experience supporting military and national defense. I possess a TS/SCI/CI/Poly Clearance and I am now seeking career opportunities with defense, intelligence and security contractors to continue my career in intelligence community as a Signal Intelligence (SIGINT) Analyst. I am self-motivated individual and very proficient in multiple disciplines of Signals Analysis; SIGINT Geospatial Anlysis (SGA), Analysis and Reporting, Cyberspace Warfare, and proficient in multiple all source intelligence databases and tools including: PINWALE, HOMEBASE, ArcGIS, ARCVIEW, SEDB, FASCIA, DISHFIRE, MAINWAY, CPE, RENOIR, OCTAVE, ANCHORY/MAUI, CREST, AMHS, INTELINK, SPOTBEAM, BEAMER, SKYWRITER, CONTRACTIVE, GOOGLE EARTH, DRT, GCCS-M, TAC, SIGNAV and RFMP-Builder. I am a problem solver, critical thinker, motivated and dedicated team player who has proven results and communicates authoritatively, both orally and written. As a work-center Subject Matter Expert, I focused on activities in Middle Eastern and Africa regions for nine years and fuse intelligence from SIGINT and GEOINT collected resources to developed reliable intelligence reports or recommendation packages to support national mission assignments, effects planning, and non-kinetic fire mission. As a Senior Analyst, I helped managed all aspects of the mission requirements and built a client base by consistently providing excellent service. I am a great technical mentor and trainer and have authored five technical standard operation procedure (SOP) booklets to improve collection and training pipelines. I am willing to relocate to Maryland, Washington D.C., Northern Virginia, Augusta Georgia, San Diego CA, and overseas.

summary: I am professional and accomplished Intelligence Analyst with 18 years experience supporting military and national defense. I possess a TS/SCI/CI/Poly Clearance and I am now seeking career opportunities with defense, intelligence and security contractors to continue my career in intelligence community as a Signal Intelligence (SIGINT) Analyst. I am self-motivated individual and very proficient in multiple disciplines of Signals Analysis; SIGINT Geospatial Anlysis (SGA), Analysis and Reporting, Cyberspace Warfare, and proficient in multiple all source intelligence databases and tools including: PINWALE, HOMEBASE, ArcGIS, ARCVIEW, SEDB, FASCIA, DISHFIRE, MAINWAY, CPE, RENOIR, OCTAVE, ANCHORY/MAUI, CREST, AMHS, INTELINK, SPOTBEAM, BEAMER, SKYWRITER, CONTRACTIVE, GOOGLE EARTH, DRT, GCCS-M, TAC, SIGNAV and RFMP-Builder. I am a problem solver, critical thinker, motivated and dedicated team player who has proven results and communicates authoritatively, both orally and written. As a work-center Subject Matter Expert, I focused on activities in Middle Eastern and Africa regions for nine years and fuse intelligence from SIGINT and GEOINT collected resources to developed reliable intelligence reports or recommendation packages to support national mission assignments, effects planning, and non-kinetic fire mission. As a Senior Analyst, I helped managed all aspects of the mission requirements and built a client base by consistently providing excellent service. I am a great technical mentor and trainer and have authored five technical standard operation procedure (SOP) booklets to improve collection and training pipelines. I am willing to relocate to Maryland, Washington D.C., Northern Virginia, Augusta Georgia, San Diego CA, and overseas.

summary: I am professional and accomplished Intelligence Analyst with 18 years experience supporting military and national defense. I possess a TS/SCI/CI/Poly Clearance and I am now seeking career opportunities with defense, intelligence and security contractors to continue my career in intelligence community as a Signal Intelligence (SIGINT) Analyst. I am self-motivated individual and very proficient in multiple disciplines of Signals Analysis; SIGINT Geospatial Anlysis (SGA), Analysis and Reporting, Cyberspace Warfare, and proficient in multiple all source intelligence databases and tools including: PINWALE, HOMEBASE, ArcGIS, ARCVIEW, SEDB, FASCIA, DISHFIRE, MAINWAY, CPE, RENOIR, OCTAVE, ANCHORY/MAUI, CREST, AMHS, INTELINK, SPOTBEAM, BEAMER, SKYWRITER, CONTRACTIVE, GOOGLE EARTH, DRT, GCCS-M, TAC, SIGNAV and RFMP-Builder. I am a problem solver, critical thinker, motivated and dedicated team player who has proven results and communicates authoritatively, both orally and written. As a work-center Subject Matter Expert, I focused on activities in Middle Eastern and Africa regions for nine years and fuse intelligence from SIGINT and GEOINT collected resources to developed reliable intelligence reports or recommendation packages to support national mission assignments, effects planning, and non-kinetic fire mission. As a Senior Analyst, I helped managed all aspects of the mission requirements and built a client base by consistently providing excellent service. I am a great technical mentor and trainer and have authored five technical standard operation procedure (SOP) booklets to improve collection and training pipelines. I am willing to relocate to Maryland, Washington D.C., Northern Virginia, Augusta Georgia, San Diego CA, and overseas.

As a Senior Analyst, I helped managed all aspects of the mission requirements and built a client base by consistently providing excellent service. I am a great technical mentor and trainer and have authored five technical standard operation procedure (SOP) booklets to improve collection and training pipelines. I am willing to relocate to Maryland, Washington D.C., Northern Virginia, Augusta Georgia, San Diego CA, and overseas.

summary: I am professional and accomplished Intelligence Analyst with 18 years experience supporting military and national defense. I possess a TS/SCI/CI/Poly Clearance and I am now seeking career opportunities with defense, intelligence and security contractors to continue my career in intelligence community as a Signal Intelligence (SIGINT) Analyst. I am self-motivated individual and very proficient in multiple disciplines of Signals Analysis; SIGINT Geospatial Anlysis (SGA), Analysis and Reporting, Cyberspace Warfare, and proficient in multiple all source intelligence databases and tools including: PINWALE, HOMEBASE, ArcGIS, ARCVIEW, SEDB, FASCIA, DISHFIRE, MAINWAY, CPE, RENOIR, OCTAVE, ANCHORY/MAUI, CREST, AMHS, INTELINK, SPOTBEAM, BEAMER, SKYWRITER, CONTRACTIVE, GOOGLE EARTH, DRT, GCCS-M, TAC, SIGNAV and RFMP-Builder. I am a problem solver, critical thinker, motivated and dedicated team player who has proven results and communicates authoritatively, both orally and written. As a work-center Subject Matter Expert, I focused on activities in Middle Eastern and Africa regions for nine years and fuse intelligence from SIGINT and GEOINT collected resources to developed reliable intelligence reports or recommendation packages to support national mission assignments, effects planning, and non-kinetic fire mission. As a Senior Analyst, I helped managed all aspects of the mission requirements and built a client base by consistently providing excellent service. I am a great technical mentor and trainer and have authored five technical standard operation procedure (SOP) booklets to improve collection and training pipelines. I am willing to relocate to Maryland, Washington D.C., Northern Virginia, Augusta Georgia, San Diego CA, and overseas.

summary: I am professional and accomplished Intelligence Analyst with 18 years experience supporting military and national defense. I possess a TS/SCI/CI/Poly Clearance and I am now seeking career opportunities with defense, intelligence and security contractors to continue my career in intelligence community as a Signal Intelligence (SIGINT) Analyst. I am self-motivated individual and very proficient in multiple disciplines of Signals Analysis; SIGINT Geospatial Anlysis (SGA), Analysis and Reporting, Cyberspace Warfare, and proficient in multiple all source intelligence databases and tools including: PINWALE, HOMEBASE, ArcGIS, ARCVIEW, SEDB, FASCIA, DISHFIRE, MAINWAY, CPE, RENOIR, OCTAVE, ANCHORY/MAUI, CREST, AMHS, INTELINK, SPOTBEAM, BEAMER, SKYWRITER, CONTRACTIVE, GOOGLE EARTH, DRT, GCCS-M, TAC, SIGNAV and RFMP-Builder. I am a problem solver, critical thinker, motivated and dedicated team player who has proven results and communicates authoritatively, both orally and written. As a work-center Subject Matter Expert, I focused on activities in Middle Eastern and Africa regions for nine years and fuse intelligence from SIGINT and GEOINT collected resources to developed reliable intelligence reports or recommendation packages to support national mission assignments, effects planning, and non-kinetic fire mission. As a Senior Analyst, I helped managed all aspects of the mission requirements and built a client base by consistently providing excellent service. I am a great technical mentor and trainer and have authored five technical standard operation procedure (SOP) booklets to improve collection and training pipelines. I am willing to relocate to Maryland, Washington D.C., Northern Virginia, Augusta Georgia, San Diego CA, and overseas.

summary: I am professional and accomplished Intelligence Analyst with 18 years experience supporting military and national defense. I possess a TS/SCI/CI/Poly Clearance and I am now seeking career opportunities with defense, intelligence and security contractors to continue my career in intelligence community as a Signal Intelligence (SIGINT) Analyst. I am self-motivated individual and very proficient in multiple disciplines of Signals Analysis; SIGINT Geospatial Anlysis (SGA), Analysis and Reporting, Cyberspace Warfare, and proficient in multiple all source intelligence databases and tools including: PINWALE, HOMEBASE, ArcGIS, ARCVIEW, SEDB, FASCIA, DISHFIRE, MAINWAY, CPE, RENOIR, OCTAVE, ANCHORY/MAUI, CREST, AMHS, INTELINK, SPOTBEAM, BEAMER, SKYWRITER, CONTRACTIVE, GOOGLE EARTH, DRT, GCCS-M, TAC, SIGNAV and RFMP-Builder. I am a problem solver, critical thinker, motivated and dedicated team player who has proven results and communicates authoritatively, both orally and written. As a work-center Subject Matter Expert, I focused on activities in Middle Eastern and Africa regions for nine years and fuse intelligence from SIGINT and GEOINT collected resources to developed reliable intelligence reports or recommendation packages to support national mission assignments, effects planning, and non-kinetic fire mission. As a Senior Analyst, I helped managed all aspects of the mission requirements and built a client base by consistently providing excellent service. I am a great technical mentor and trainer and have authored five technical standard operation procedure (SOP) booklets to improve collection and training pipelines. I am willing to relocate to Maryland, Washington D.C., Northern Virginia, Augusta Georgia, San Diego CA, and overseas.

description: Operated as an intelligence analyst and reporter while working with linguist and analysts in a joint environment to provide threat tippers, target characterizations, answers for Requests for Information (RFI's), and analytical products. Part of a team of Signal Intelligence Analysts in support of Brigade and Division level assets who developed high value individuals which led to the capture of numerous high value individuals and reduced the IED threat drastically. Exposure to All-Source Analysis systems, ELINT and FUSION Analysis as well as HUMINT andIMINT. Incorporated research and analysis of all-source data derived from multiple and specialized databases into actionable intelligence products. Wrote several Informal Technical Notes (ITNs) focused on high interest activity in the Middle East. Created working database for long-term analytical focuses and assisted in the construction of a new SOP in order to increase mission effectiveness and decrease the time needed for a new analyst to become mission capable. Experience with the following communications systems: GSM, HPCP, VOICESAIL, PUSH TO TALK, and DTMF Devices Provided training for intelligence soldiers ready to deploy on Insurgency communications, SIGINT analyst, target packages, and methodology behind tracking terrorist networks. Produced numerous SIGINT Intelligence packages for forward deployed units. (Daily use and access) software and programs: Association, Mainway, Banyan, Fascia, SIGINT Navigator, ArcView, GoldMiner, sharkFinn, GeoT,SortingLead, Renoir, Pathfinder, GRSOC Metrics, Analysts Notebook, Global reach, Gistqueue and Other SIGINT related databases Provided actionable intelligence reports in direct support of real world counter-terrorist operations. description: Assigned to the 4th Brigade of 10th Mountain Division on the CIAT contract. Primarily responsible for researching, developing, presenting and publishing SIGINT products at the tactical and operational level related to insurgent IED cell activities, and threats to local/regional stability as part of an overall C-IED analytical team. Conducted analysis of raw and fused signals intelligence data of insurgents who are directly linked to the acquisition, production, transportation, emplacement and employment of IEDs. o Provide input to multiple Government requirements and objectives, assists with the analysis and production of various intelligence products specifically focused on the C-IED mission set, and supplies analytical support for senior Military leaders. o Attend meetings and conduct comprehensive research on complex topics independently and as a part of a larger analytical effort focusing on IED-related current events and long-term trends that could impact the supported units mission.

description: Contracting for the DIA in National Military Command Center (NMCC), National Joint Operations Intelligence Center (NJOIC) section of the Pentagon. Function as a member of a large multi-INT team to provide intelligence support. o Access, review, correlate, and analyze information from multiple intelligence discipline reports daily. Collaborate with Combatant Commands (COCOMs), Services, Intelligence Agencies, and CENTCOM Component Commands and other DoD and interagency organizations. o Produce and disseminate finished intelligence products on global geopolitical problem-sets, including global leadership dynamics, foreign policy, economics, elections, political factions, and opposition groups. Leverage data mining tools/databases such as M3, WISE, WIRe, HOTR, online Economist, Pathfinder, and OSC to provide global geopolitical intelligence products. o Produce and provide intelligence briefings as required. Respond to Command-directed tasks for short and long-term political assessments and products.

description: Deployed to Iraq in support of project Legacy and Gryphon as a GSE-13 Senior HUMINT Analyst. Embedded with the 2nd Marine Expeditionary Force at Al Asad Air Base and the 3rd Infantry Division at Camp Speicher with the mission of coordinating movement of mission essential personnel and equipment in theater while simultaneously providing program intelligence analysis to the government. o Pooled and processed Human Intelligence from over 30 different locations to produce briefs and reports for key decision makers. o Conducted research and analysis of insurgency, terrorism, conventional operations, information operations, and asymmetric warfare trends and moved HUMINT assets based on the analysis. o Coordinated travel of all program personnel and equipment in the West and North in a timely manner to ensure mission completion. o Created analytical product that assisted in critical decision making and received certificates of exceptional performance while working in a zero supervision environment. o Trained, supervised, and delegated duties to 2 other civilian analysts in theater.

description: Provided CNE support to the STDA section of INSCOM with accurate, relevant, and timely SIGINT products for dissemination to DoD agencies and other U.S. Government elements. • Utilized common intelligence community networks (JWICS, SIPRNet, NIPRNET and NSANET) as required, to coordinate requirements and issues with intelligence community partners. • Promulgated findings per National Security Agency (NSA) standard reporting formats and STDA SOPs for serialized and informal reports. • Conducted intelligence research and analysis of data derived from multiple and specialized databases to include; M3, SharkFinn, Association, Global Reach, ArcGis, Google Earth, Banyan, Agility, Gold Miner, Anchory, Maui, Octave, Pathfinder, PINWALE, Global Reach, Marina, Fascia, and Dishfire.

description: Assigned to Secret Compartmented Information Facility to support Cobra Focus, an intelligence fusion cell supporting the war on terror. Provided Analytic and Linguistic support by assisting deployed units with an overflow of unprocessed intelligence for DNI/DNR missions. Navigated numerous NSANET Databases to correlate information and produce detailed reports. Fused Human Intelligence, Signal Intelligence, and Image Intelligence to create detailed target packages. • Frequently input data into data processing systems to include; Analyst Notebook, Excel, PowerPoint, Microsoft Word, QueryTree, ArcGis, ArcView, SharkFinn, Gold Miner, Anchory, Maui, Octave, Pathfinder, PINWALE, Global Reach, Association, Fascia, and Dishfire. • Upon completion of a project, briefed updated intelligence to superiors so they could make key tactical and strategic operational decisions. Utilized mIRC and JABBER chat regularly

summary: Everyone is always looking for improvement whether it be financially or socially when it comes to home improvement the choice might not be so easy. With a broad range of experience in the home improvement sector accumulated during a 25 year career with in this industry 8 of which I have worked for various companies in the window door and floor market. I am the owner and director of Donnellon Home Improvement based in Coolock County Dublin With 17 years of being in business. We have helped every day home owners obtain their dream home. With our windows ranging from our elegance to our standard range all A rated with the highest security rating in their sector, Through to our Composite doors ranging from front to back doors as well as our wooden and laminated flooring and internal doors with a vast amount of wood from oak to beech and designs to chose from with designs to chose from with each door to add your own personal touch. We will cater for every need, Whether it is refurbishing your bathrooms, installing a new kitchen, adding an extension or any small renovation replacing or adding a new front door, windows or floors thats where we come in. After all I believe in creating and fostering relationships is a cornerstone of conducting business.

description: Spotting a gap in the market for the installation of high quality windows, doors, fascia and soffits, gardening, landscaping, kitchens, bathrooms, conservatories and renovations in Dublin. Myself and Paul Hynes also a native of County Down Northern Ireland set up Donnellon Home improvement. We have built our business on our reputation for providing a full home improvements personal service from start to finish, quality products and services at affordable prices, products built to the latest standard in energy saving and security.

description: • Designed and developed Java and ASP.NET/SQL web OOP applications to facilitate the incident management, outage tracking processes, and account administration requests. Sole designer and developer of the COV Account Request ASP.NET web application that is utilized by the Commonwealth of Virginia. https://esupport.virginia.gov/accountrequest. • Act as Northrop Grumman's CSA (Customer Service Alert) outage coordinator and IT Support Lead for the VITA program. Responsible for tracking and communicating outage information that affects the business functionality of the entire Commonwealth of Virginia. • Supervise all 3rd shift team employees and provide support to all commonwealth state agencies via the VITA (Virginia Information Technology Agency) contract, VAI (Vought Aircraft Industries) and NCIS (Naval Criminal Investigative Services). • Provide business continuity to a variety of end users through various channels of communication. • Respond to end user contacts through incoming phone calls, emails, and web tickets. • Responsible for troubleshooting and resolving issues relating to password resets, unlocks, and COTS (Commercial off the Shelf) software packages, and for hardware systems ranging from desktops and servers, to circuits and routers. • Work across a number of secure domains and have access to remote technologies in order to troubleshoot and correct end-users’ issues. • Experience with HP ServiceCenter (Legacy Peregrine) hands on support and implementation.

description: • Designed and engineered image products that generated millions of dollars in revenue. Products include: pylon signs, monument signs, fascia elements, awnings, ATM surrounds, ATM toppers, kiosks, interior showroom elements, prototypes, trade show booths, and large format graphics. • Developed the ability to create computerized 3D models of custom products which eliminated the cost of prototype engineering and production and trained supervisors and co-workers how to design 3D models and animate. • Adapted to changing roles and mastered new responsibilities quickly. • Authored and created marketing materials and business-to-business multimedia presentations which led to the winning of multi-million dollar accounts. • Participated closely in the overall design process of ImagePoint.com, Web Catalog, e-Luminate, and the esthetics of the content. • Influenced others through a strong understanding of product needs, and was able to make tough budget/product decisions. • Worked as a team with six designers completing over 3,000 projects in one year and meeting strict deadlines.

description: Missione di appoggio tecnico al coordinamento COOPI di Bangui, finalizzato all’analisi e valutazione della situazione esistente, del progetto in corso à Bria-Ippy e della scrittura di nuovi progetti di sicurezza alimentare in RCA collegato all’aiuto di urgenza, la riabilitazione e lo sviluppo nella sottoprefettura di Bia (prefettura Huate Kotto) e nelle prefetture di Lobaye e Ombella Mpoko. Attività principali della missione: redazione di 3 proposte di progetto (1 sviluppo locale nella Lobaye, 2 sicurezza alimentare/nutrizione nella zona Bria-Ippy); appoggio tecnico al progetto “assurer la sécurité alimentaire des populations affectées par les conflits dans le centre de la RCA, Préfecture de la Ouaka et de la Haute Kotto (DCI-FOOD/2014/343-269) ».

summary: Key qualifications: * 12 years of professional experience including 10 years in West and Central Africa; * Technical and administrative management of development projects in the field of food security, natural resources and local development, good governance (NSA & LA); * Project conception, including budget and logical framework; * Project cycle management, monitoring and evaluation; * Mastery of tools of analysis of the context and priorities of the choices (causes and effects diagram, SWOT analysis, multicriteria analysis…); * Mastery of tools and techniques for local development; * Support to farmer organizations; * Planning and land management, village self-analysis; * Soil conservation (erosion control), watershed management, rural water supply; * Agricultural production and marketing support to producers; * Technical assistance to cooperatives, NGOs; * Technical training.

description: - Missione Niger (14-30 giugno 2014): Monitoraggio della gestione tecnica, amministrativa e finanziaria del progetto RIRE in loco (rete spazi di riflessione per le donne nel dipartimento di Say); gestione e rafforzamento dei rapporti con i partner, il personale locale, i finanziatori, i beneficiari delle attività e le autorità locali; supervisione delle procedure interne per il reclutamento e la formazione del personale del nuovo progetto. - Missione Senegal (15 – 31 maggio 2014): scrittura del progetto “Terra e Pace” in risposta al bando EuropeAid/135549/DD/ACT/Multi (sostegno degli attori locali per la stabilità della pace in Africa occidentale); riflessioni con il partner locale (CNCR) e visita strutture e attori da coinvolgere nel progetto à Ziguinchor e nel dipartimento di Bignona (Regione Casamance). A Foundiougne (regione di Fatik) missione di appoggio al progetto “Acqua e Terra Delta Saloum” finanziato dalla regione Emilia-Romagna; visita dei produttori di riso, apicoltori e avicoltori nelle isole coinvolte dal progetto; analisi della situazione e dei problemi incontrati dal progetto. - Attività presso la sede Italia dell’Ong (marzo e aprile 2014): i) seguire la messa in opera del nuovo progetto in Niger (RIRE) tramite accordi col partner, reclutamento del personale del progetto, logistica (uffici, mezzi, ecc.), definizione strategie d’intervento e responsabilità di messa in opera. ii) chiudere i rendiconti tecnici e finanziari dei progetti Niger chiusi nel 2013.

description: Missioni specifiche di diversi mesi in Niger. Gestione tecnica, amministrativa e finanziaria dei progetti; gestione e rafforzamento dei rapporti con i partner, il personale locale, i finanziatori, i beneficiari delle attività e le autorità locali; redazione dei rapporti tecnici e finanziari; supervisione delle procedure interne per il reclutamento e la formazione del personale locale; scrittura di nuovi progetti e del programma d’intervento dell’ONG nella regione di Tahoua; finalizzazione della strategia d'intervento dell'ONG nel Paese; ricerca di finanziamenti per la messa in opera dei progetti e programmi. Da gennaio 2013 collaborazione part-time con l'ufficio progetti dell'ONG, durante i periodi in Italia.

summary: Key qualifications: * 12 years of professional experience including 10 years in West and Central Africa; * Technical and administrative management of development projects in the field of food security, natural resources and local development, good governance (NSA & LA); * Project conception, including budget and logical framework; * Project cycle management, monitoring and evaluation; * Mastery of tools of analysis of the context and priorities of the choices (causes and effects diagram, SWOT analysis, multicriteria analysis…); * Mastery of tools and techniques for local development; * Support to farmer organizations; * Planning and land management, village self-analysis; * Soil conservation (erosion control), watershed management, rural water supply; * Agricultural production and marketing support to producers; * Technical assistance to cooperatives, NGOs; * Technical training.

description: Studio e concepimento in Niger di un programma di operazioni congiunte World Food Program – International Found for Agricultural Development, settore “filets sociaux” e particolarmente “cash for work”. Riunioni di lavoro e visite di terreno nelle Regioni di Tahoua, Zinder e Maradi con i responsabili locali dell’IFAD e del WFP, incontri con i principali attori dell’intervento. Principali responsabilità della missione: i) apprezzamento globale della strategia e del quadro istituzionale e operativo di messa in opera del programma; ii) analisi e valutazione globale degli elementi tecnici e finanziari degli interventi proposti; iii) analisi dell’efficacia delle opere tecnique proposte (demi-lune, banquettes, opere CES e di riabilitazione); iv) valutazione e apprezzamento degli approcci (impatti) e dei dispositivi (efficienza e efficacia) esistenti; v) elaborazione della proposta per la mobilizzazione del cofinanziamento WFP al programma PASADEM; vi) elaborazione del programma quadro IFAD-WFP nelle tre regioni; vii) consolidamento e redazione finale del rapporto tecnico dello studio. Alla fine della missione, una settimana presso la sede IFAD a Roma per finalizzare la proposta.

description: Valutazione finale del progetto: « Améliorer la sécurité alimentaire dans les communes de Kayokwe, Ndava et Nyabihanga (Province de Mwaro) au Burundi (DCI-FOOD/2008/169-93) », azione cofinanziata dall’UE e messa in opera dall’ONG LVIA. La missione di valutazione si è svolta in tre fasi: studio dei documenti, incontri con i principali responsabili della messa in opera e finanziamento del progetto, uscite di terreno per incontrare i beneficiari e visionare le realizzazioni. Alla fine un’analisi approfondita dei dati e la redazione di un rapporto hanno concluso il lavoro.

summary: Key qualifications: * 12 years of professional experience including 10 years in West and Central Africa; * Technical and administrative management of development projects in the field of food security, natural resources and local development, good governance (NSA & LA); * Project conception, including budget and logical framework; * Project cycle management, monitoring and evaluation; * Mastery of tools of analysis of the context and priorities of the choices (causes and effects diagram, SWOT analysis, multicriteria analysis…); * Mastery of tools and techniques for local development; * Support to farmer organizations; * Planning and land management, village self-analysis; * Soil conservation (erosion control), watershed management, rural water supply; * Agricultural production and marketing support to producers; * Technical assistance to cooperatives, NGOs; * Technical training.

description: Gestione tecnica, amministrativa e finanziaria dei progetti; gestione e rafforzamento dei rapporti con i partner, il personale locale, i finanziatori, i beneficiari delle attività e le autorità locali; redazione dei rapporti tecnici e finanziari; supervisione delle procedure interne per il reclutamento e la formazione del personale locale; scrittura di nuovi progetti e del programma d’intervento dell’ONG nella regione di Tahoua; ricerca di finanziamenti per la messa in opera dei progetti e del programma.

summary: Key qualifications: * 12 years of professional experience including 10 years in West and Central Africa; * Technical and administrative management of development projects in the field of food security, natural resources and local development, good governance (NSA & LA); * Project conception, including budget and logical framework; * Project cycle management, monitoring and evaluation; * Mastery of tools of analysis of the context and priorities of the choices (causes and effects diagram, SWOT analysis, multicriteria analysis…); * Mastery of tools and techniques for local development; * Support to farmer organizations; * Planning and land management, village self-analysis; * Soil conservation (erosion control), watershed management, rural water supply; * Agricultural production and marketing support to producers; * Technical assistance to cooperatives, NGOs; * Technical training.

description: 1) valutazione finale del progetto « gestion participative des ressources naturelles et promotion des activités génératrices de revenu dans un processus de développement local au Tchad (ONG-PVD/2006/131-744) » abbreviato in GEPAR, cofinanziato dall’UE e dall’ONG ACRA di Milano. 2) valutazione intermedia del progetto « Gestion participative des ressources forestières et promotion d’initiatives économiques éco-compatibles dans la Vallée du Logone (ENV/2006/114-747) » cofinanziato dall’UE e dall’ONG ACRA di Milano. Il progetto si svolge in due Paesi (Ciad e Cameroun). L’equipe di valutazione era composta da due esperti (compreso il sottoscritto); la missione è stata divisa in tre fasi principali: studio dei documenti, incontri con i principali responsabili della messa in opera e finanziamento dei progetti, uscite di terreno per incontrare i beneficiari e visionare le realizzazioni. Alla fine un’analisi approfondita dei dati e la redazione di un rapporto hanno concluso il lavoro. Le valutazioni esterne rientravano nel normale svolgimento dei progetti e sono state commissionate allo studio GEA da: ONG ACRA (Associazione di Cooperazione Rurale en Africa e America latina); Via E. Breda, 54 - 20126 Milano – IT, Tel. +39 02.27000291 / Fax +39 02.2552270 – info@acra.it

description: « Mesures d’accompagnement à la concertation et au renforcement des capacités des communautés et comités d’action dans le département des Monts de Lam (007/ACT/FED/9ACP/CD/013/SUBV/14/2008) ». L’azione rientrava nel quadro del PASILD (Programme Structurant d’Initiatives Locales de Développement), programma finanziato dalla Commissione Europea e messo in opera dall’ Ordonnateur National FED in Ciad (Ministero dell’Economia e del Piano). Obiettivo specifico: accompagnare la strutturazione delle comunità rurali e dei comitati di riflessione/validazione/accompagnamento del dipartimento dei Monti di Lam e rinforzare le loro competenze in pianificazione e concertazione. Risultati attesi: - organizzazione e gestione dei comitati e comunità d’azione rinforzati a tutti i livelli per favorire il buon governo; - strategie locali di sviluppo sostenibile definite e validate dai comitati competenti; - iniziative pilote dei piani di sviluppo messe in opera dagli attori locali. Le attività del progetto mirano alla strutturazione delle comunità rurali, alla loro buona gestione, alla definizione dei piani di sviluppo locale, al rafforzamento delle capacità dei comitati di validazione dei piani e all’appoggio delle iniziative ritenute.

summary: Key qualifications: * 12 years of professional experience including 10 years in West and Central Africa; * Technical and administrative management of development projects in the field of food security, natural resources and local development, good governance (NSA & LA); * Project conception, including budget and logical framework; * Project cycle management, monitoring and evaluation; * Mastery of tools of analysis of the context and priorities of the choices (causes and effects diagram, SWOT analysis, multicriteria analysis…); * Mastery of tools and techniques for local development; * Support to farmer organizations; * Planning and land management, village self-analysis; * Soil conservation (erosion control), watershed management, rural water supply; * Agricultural production and marketing support to producers; * Technical assistance to cooperatives, NGOs; * Technical training.

description: Part time Learning Manager developing a new and exciting education offer to maximise curriculum links to the collection as the Museum moves to a brand new premises for the new academic year! Leading a team of volunteers to deliver workshops & handling collection sessions to learners from EYFS, through the Key Stages to FE & HE level. Specialising in curriculum-related topics for Art & Design, Graphics, Packaging, Business Studies, Branding, Intellectual Property & Marketing. Managing learning projects including Kids in Museums 'Takeover Day'.

description: Developing an innovative new curriculum & live project opportunities for the Creative & Cultural Apprenticeship programmes at Tower Hamlets College. Working with leading museums, galleries & theatres to deliver apprenticeships in the cultural industry. Delivering Design Support apprenticeships to increase employment opportunities for talented young individuals in the design industry, & support the growth of small design practices.

description: Factory Forecasting is a collective of renowned industry experts in womenswear design, buying and trend forecasting with specialists in Footwear, Accessories, Jersey, Knitwear, Catwalk Analysis, Fashion Retail and Visual Merchandising. Factory Forecasting's combined skillset offers unique insight and experience of the entire fashion product development life cycle across all the design disciplines. Accessing our unrivalled expertise and industry knowledge will enable your buying, design and merchandising teams to make swift, informed and accurate design decisions.

description: Education & Quality Assurance professional responsible for developing and managing the curriculum for the Bluewater Apprenticeship Scheme in Retail at Level 2 & Level 3; leading a team of Assessors to deliver Retail Apprenticeships in partnership with the Sector Skills Council; supporting learners on vocational placements and securing sustainable employment; accountable for internal quality assurance and maintaining relationships with awarding bodies, the NSA for Retail and commercial L&D departments.

description: Lecturer & Programme Team Leader managing a team of Lecturers and Assessors to provide world class training and business support across a spectrum of retail business areas. Experienced education professional developing and managing delivery of the curriculum for Fashion Retail, VM and Retail qualifications; introducing the Level 3 Diploma in Fashion Retail exceeding recruitment targets by 72% in its first year and achieving 100% success rates in coaching learners to secure sustainable employment. Created award-winning e-Learning strategies to accommodate differentiated learning needs.

description: Multi-disciplinary Lecturer teaching Historical & Contextual Studies to groups of 180+ FE students on Fine Art, 3D Design, Fashion, Photography, Graphic Design and Multimedia. 3D Design specialist leading projects on furniture design, interior design, and architecture and curriculum development to include retail design and visual merchandising. Achievements included team teaching with a Turner Prize winner on a live design and installation project, and writing and delivering design briefs, SoWs and session plans to achieve Grade 1 results.

description: Experienced Visual Merchandiser responsible for areas of up to 23 stores and 7 different fascias; the design and implementation of displays and seasonal layout changes; training and development of staff and management trainees; and the refitting of new acquisitions in London and Ireland. summary: Key qualifications: * 12 years of professional experience including 10 years in West and Central Africa; * Technical and administrative management of development projects in the field of food security, natural resources and local development, good governance (NSA & LA); * Project conception, including budget and logical framework; * Mastery of tools of analysis of the context and priorities of the choices (causes and effects diagram, SWOT analysis, multicriteria analysis…); * Mastery of tools and techniques for local development; * Support to farmer organizations; * Planning and land management, village self-analysis; * Soil conservation (erosion control), watershed management, rural water supply; * Agricultural production and marketing support to producers; * Project cycle management, monitoring and evaluation; * Technical assistance to cooperatives, NGOs; * Technical training.

summary: Key qualifications: * 12 years of professional experience including 10 years in West and Central Africa; * Technical and administrative management of development projects in the field of food security, natural resources and local development, good governance (NSA & LA); * Project conception, including budget and logical framework; * Mastery of tools of analysis of the context and priorities of the choices (causes and effects diagram, SWOT analysis, multicriteria analysis…); * Mastery of tools and techniques for local development; * Support to farmer organizations; * Planning and land management, village self-analysis; * Soil conservation (erosion control), watershed management, rural water supply; * Agricultural production and marketing support to producers; * Project cycle management, monitoring and evaluation; * Technical assistance to cooperatives, NGOs; * Technical training.

summary: Key qualifications: * 12 years of professional experience including 10 years in West and Central Africa; * Technical and administrative management of development projects in the field of food security, natural resources and local development, good governance (NSA & LA); * Project conception, including budget and logical framework; * Mastery of tools of analysis of the context and priorities of the choices (causes and effects diagram, SWOT analysis, multicriteria analysis…); * Mastery of tools and techniques for local development; * Support to farmer organizations; * Planning and land management, village self-analysis; * Soil conservation (erosion control), watershed management, rural water supply; * Agricultural production and marketing support to producers; * Project cycle management, monitoring and evaluation; * Technical assistance to cooperatives, NGOs; * Technical training.
